model

Interface StockModel

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MockStockModel, StockModelImpl

    public interface StockModel
    The interface defines a StockModel where user can do some manipulation of stocks he owns.

    • Method Detail

      • createPortfolio

        void createPortfolio(java.lang.String portfolioName)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        The method create a new empty Portfolio with given name.
        Parameters:
        portfolioName - The given Portfolio name.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the name is illegal.

      • createPortfolio

        double createPortfolio(java.lang.String portfolioName,
                       java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> information,
                       double amt,
                       java.lang.String date)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method create a fixed portfolio with specific buying plan.
        Parameters:
        portfolioName - The given Portfolio name.
        information - The information of the buying plan with some companies to buy and their percentage.
        amt - The amount of money you want to buy.
        date - The date you want to buy this portfolio.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the name is illegal. If the information goes wrong. If the buying fails.

      • dollarCostAverage

        double dollarCostAverage(java.lang.String portfolioName,
                         java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> information,
                         double amt,
                         java.lang.String startDate,
                         java.lang.String endDate,
                         int interval)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method create a fixed portfolio with specific buying plan. It will buy after a certain period of time. If a date is not available, it will automatically search for a nearest available date.
        Parameters:
        portfolioName - The given Portfolio name.
        information - The information of the buying plan with some companies to buy and their percentage.
        amt - The amount of money you want to buy.
        startDate - The starting date you want to buy this portfolio.
        endDate - The ending date you want to buy this portfolio.
        interval - The interval of two dates of buying.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the name is illegal. If the information goes wrong. If the buying fails.

      • buy

        double buy(java.lang.String portfolioName,
           java.lang.String companyName,
           double shares,
           java.lang.String date,
           java.lang.String priceType)
    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        The method buy some stock in the market and add them to a designated Portfolio. Modify: add a parameter name priceType.
        Parameters:
        portfolioName - The target Portfolio that user whats to put stocks in.
        companyName - The company's name of the desire stocks.
        shares - The desired number of shares.
        date - The date of the stock.
        priceType - The type of price.
        Returns:
        The total cost of this buy-in.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If any argument is illegal.

      • determineCost

        double determineCost(java.lang.String portfolioName)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        The method determines the total costs of all stocks in a portfolio.
        Parameters:
        portfolioName - The desired Portfolio name.
        Returns:
        The total cost (low price) of stocks.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If any argument is illegal.

        The method determines the value of all stocks in a portfolio at a certain date..
        Parameters:
        portfolioName - The desired Portfolio name.
        date - The date of interests.
        Returns:
        The total value (high price) of stocks.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If any argument is illegal.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The commission fee of this portfolio.
